metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18198 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
print_iso9660_recurse in iso-info.c in GNU libcdio before 1.0.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted iso file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18198` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcdio-cdda1 - 0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm1
libcdio-paranoia1 - 0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm1
libcdio-utils - 0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm1
libcdio13 - 0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm1
libiso9660-8 - 0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm1
libudf0 - 0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libcdio package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.83-4.2ubuntu1+esm1').
